intro: Linanthus nudicaulis, commonly known as the naked-stem flax, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the evening primrose family (Onagraceae) and is characterized by its slender, leafless stems and small, yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Linanthus nudicaulis is adapted to arid environments and is often found in regions with low precipitation.
